page.title: 01Billingshurst and district
page.content:
This is a predominantly rural area which has one large village in its{ {North West}corner. Farmhouses and cottages cluster together through the area which is crossed by{narrow lanes} and two{major roads}running North-South and East-West.The area adjoins the old{Roman road}of{Stane {Street}but grew mainly after the railway came in the 19thc. The landscape gently undulates and has little of the natural woodland present at the time of the first{Domesday} survey. Buildings are a mixture of old (half-timbered or stone) and new (brick and weatherboarding).
Many people commute to work to{London, {Gatwick Airport or Horsham.} Unemployment is low and the area has a prosperous feel.
